climbs.name: True North
climbs.fa: Harvey Dellos Reyes and Marty Karabin

content.description: Face climb on solid rock. Tougher than rated start past two bolts to a two bolt anchor. Plenty of hands and feet on this climb. A good warm up.
content.protection: two bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Northernmost climb at Lost Wall. If facing Lost Wall, this is the bolted route on the far right.

content.description: Fun face climbing on good rock with many pockets. This start is the toughest part of the climb.
content.protection: Four bolts to a two bolt anchor
content.location: This route is just to the left of True North (5.6) towards the northern part of the wall.

content.description: Difficult start eases to deep jams. Starts in the right facing dihedral in the center of the wall/
content.protection: Trad and one #4 C4 but you can get smaller gear deep in the crack.

content.description: Fun crack that angles right, then back left over a flake, finally ending in a great roof. Although the roof looks tough from the ground, there are some great hands that make the rating accurate. The crack has seen a number of climbs so it's smoother than most in the Queen Creek area. This climb is well worth doing.
content.protection: Trad. You'll need to sling the tree at the top to make a natural anchor or scramble off to your right.
content.location: Right leaning crack to the left of 'Projectiles'.

climbs.name: Projectiles
climbs.fa: Harvey Dellos Reyes and Marty Karabin

content.description: Open book type sport route with interesting climbing. The variety of moves possible make this a better than average climb worth doing.
content.protection: four bolts to a two bolt anchor
content.location: Look for the open corner to the left of the face climb Stoned (5.7)

content.description: Fun moves on this featured arete. Start on the left slab for two bolts then turn over to the right side of the arete.
Thin sport climbing. Ends at a ledge with two chain rap anchors. There is some loose (and large!) rock at the top of this climb so helmets recommended.
content.protection: five bolts to two bolt anchor chains.
content.location: Face climb just to the left of 'Shout at the Devil'. From 'Queen Creek Freak', head past the dead tree and past the crack climb ('Shout at the Devil') to the bolted face climb.

content.description: The Lost Wall is the furthest North climbing area in Upper Devils Canyon. It stands separate from most of the Upper Devils Canyon climbing, so it may be less crowded here. The majority of the climbs are sport with lowering anchors, although there are a few trad climbs. The rock is typical of Queen Creek climbing, with pockets and flakes. Some of the rock at the top of these climbs are quite loose (and quite large!), so helmets are recommended. This area gets morning sun and afternoon shade.
